results.title: A Sense of theatre
results.creator_credit: London Television Service and Revel Guest
results.brief_description: Britain’s greatest currency in the world of arts is probably her playwrights. From the great revival of British drama in the 1950s has sprung a new generation of playwrights, differing widely in ideas and approach. A study of these playwrights; the way they began to write, the way they find their subjects and the way they live their lives is made.

results.title: A Sense of the other (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Bernice Gregorio, Northwestern University, Dana H. Hodgdon and Frank Galati
results.brief_description: Shows how old English literature, such as Shakespeare, can be studied through the medium of interpretation. This is understanding the text through performing and acting out the parts, by students. Shows performances, and also discusses with students and lecturers, the value of this method of study.

results.title: A Sense of movement (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Veronica Sherborne, University of Bristol and Sue Jerrard
results.brief_description: Made at New Fosseway School for severely subnormal children in Bristol, England, the film shows 15 year olds and 6 year olds taking movement classes with Veronica Sherborne.

results.title: A Sense of involvement
results.creator_credit: David H. Fowler, New Zealand National Film Unit and David Sims
results.brief_description: The craft movement in New Zealand has established itself as strongly as in other countries. Using their different skills, potters, weavers, printmakers and sculptors are allied by a sense of involvement. Music and picture establish a mood which allows the audience to share their involvement.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David H. Fowler, New Zealand National Film Unit and David Sims

results.title: A Sense of Direction (Captioned)
results.brief_description: A look at the sport of orientating. It starts by describing map-marking and how important accurate maps are. Shows maps being made for orienteering, based on grades of difficulty that orienteers are subjected to. It concludes with the maps being used in an actual race.

results.title: A Sense of community
results.creator_credit: Sarah Stein, Charles Stewart Mott Foundation, Vision Associates and Lee R. Bobker
results.brief_description: A portrait of community education in action. Examples of programs that take place throughout the community at all hours of the day and night are given, and the Community School Council is introduced. Other more complex programs are then shown with the emphasis on the impact on lives rather than on the content of the program.

results.title: A Sense of belonging
results.creator_credit: Ronald H. Riley, R.H.R. Productions and Margaret Thomson
results.brief_description: When Mrs Morgan, a dependent and inadequate housewife, loses her husband, her two children become neglected and unwanted, especially when their mother decides to marry again - to a useless and workshy man who has no feeling for them. They lose their sense of belonging, and the boy, Martin, becomes unstable and drifts into delinquency. The story of this family, over a period of years, is seen through the eyes of a Child-care Officer from the Children’s Department of the Local Authority, and through it, a picture of an extensive welfare service is built up.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ronald H. Riley, R.H.R. Productions and Margaret Thomson

results.title: A Selection interview. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Joe Scully, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Cecil Holmes
results.brief_description:
In this film we follow one nervous applicant and the members of a selection panel to the interview room. The selection interview covers the educational background of the applicant, job expectation, the candidate’s handling of certain situations and their interests, abilities and perception of their present job. Cast includes Peter Whittle, Tony Leadley, John Warwick, Marcia Waite, Richard Meckle.
Suitable for upper secondary level.
